Field Detail

STATE_COUNT_INITIAL

public static final java.lang.String STATE_COUNT_INITIAL
The initial number of states in the generated environments.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STATE_COUNT_INCREASE_DELTA

public static final java.lang.String STATE_COUNT_INCREASE_DELTA
The amount to increase the number of states in the generated environments when the current size has been sufficiently mastered (see DIFFICULTY_INCREASE_PERFORMANCE. If the value is followed by an "x" then the value is considered a factor (and so should be > 1).

See Also:

DIFFICULTY_INCREASE_PERFORMANCE

public static final java.lang.String DIFFICULTY_INCREASE_PERFORMANCE
The performance indicating when the environment size/difficulty should be increased as the current size has been sufficiently mastered. Performance is calculated as a proportion of the maximum possible fitness (which is the sum of

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ACTION_MAP_RATIO

public static final java.lang.String ACTION_MAP_RATIO
The proportion of actions that will map to some other state. This is evaluated probabilistically for all states and actions when generating an environment.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

REWARD_STATE_RATIO

public static final java.lang.String REWARD_STATE_RATIO
The proportion of states that will contain a reward value greater than 0.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ENVIRONMENT_COUNT

public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_COUNT
The number of environments to evaluate candidates against. Increasing this will provide a more accurate evaluation but take longer.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ENVIRONMENT_CHANGE_RATE

public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_CHANGE_RATE
The fraction of environments that should be replaced with new environments per generation. This is evaluated probabilistically.

initialiseEvaluation

public void initialiseEvaluation()
Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
If required, initialise data for the current evaluation run. This method is called at the beginning of BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(List). It should be overridden if data (eg input and/or output patterns) need to be set-up before every evaluation run.

Overrides:
initialiseEvaluation in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT

evaluate

protected int evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
                       Activator substrate,
                       int evalThreadIndex)
Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
Evaluate an individual genotype. This method is called from BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(List) , and must be overridden in order to evaluate the genotypes.

Specified by:
evaluate in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
Parameters:
genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
evalThreadIndex - The index of the evaluator thread. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.

getLayerDimensions

public int[] getLayerDimensions(int layer,
                                int totalLayerCount)
Description copied from class: AHNIFitnessFunction
Sub-classes may override this to return the dimensions of the given layer.

Overrides:
getLayerDimensions in class AHNIFitnessFunction
Parameters:
layer - The 0th based index of the layer to return the dimensions of.
totalLayerCount - The total number of layers in the substrate network. This can be used to determine, for example, if the output layer has been specified.
Returns:
The dimensions of the specified layer in the format [width, height] (0th index is width, 1st index is height). To specify a 1D layer or a layer that does not use a grid layout (see AHNIFitnessFunction.getNeuronPositions(int, int)) set the height to 1 and just specify the number of neurons in the layer via the "width". If the fitness function does not wish to define dimensions for the given layer then null may be returned. This default implementation returns null for all layers.

getNeuronPositions

public Point[] getNeuronPositions(int layer,
                                  int totalLayerCount)
Description copied from class: AHNIFitnessFunction
Sub-classes may override this to return the locations of neurons in the given layer.

Overrides:
getNeuronPositions in class AHNIFitnessFunction
Parameters:
layer - The 0th based index of the layer to return the neuron locations for.
totalLayerCount - The total number of layers in the substrate network. This can be used to determine, for example, if the output layer has been specified.
Returns:
The location of neurons in the specified layer. Coordinates should be supplied in the range [0, 1], HyperNEATTranscriber.RANGE_X and the corresponding Ranges for the x and y axes will be used to translate to the user specified coordinate ranges. If the layer is 2D then the locations should be specified in row packed order. If the fitness function does not wish to define neuron positions for the given layer then null may be returned. This default implementation returns null for all layers.
